basic_info.name: AITS Kadapa Admissions
description: Admission to all the courses are made on the basis of the respective entrance examination. The entrance examination is conducted by the State of Andhra Pradesh. The exam to be given for B.Tech courses in the Andhra Pradesh Engineering, Agricultural Sciences, And Medical Common Entrance Test (EAMCET), while for the M.Tech courses, the scores in the Andhra Pradesh Post-graduate Engineering Common Entrance Test (PGECET) will be considered. Admissions are strictly based on the merit achieved in these examinations. The steps to apply are as mentioned below.

basic_info.name: AITS Kadapa Placements
description: AITS has a long list of recruiters. The Training and Placement Cell is shared with the other AITS colleges in Rajampet, Tirupati, and Hyderabad. It has a strong organizational structure and conducts many organizations and activities. The Cell conducts diverse pre-placement training sessions, and also provides students with certification programs, projects, internships, and career guidance by experts from industry.

basic_info.name: AITS Kadapa Facilities
description: Some of the facilities provided by the college include:

faqs.question: Can a diploma holder apply for M.Tech?
faqs.answer: Ans.Yes, The Convener of the Engineering Common Entrance Test admits 10% of the candidates from the stream of Diploma. However, the applicants should possess a diploma from the Andhra Pradesh State Government or an equivalent examination.

faqs.question: What is the sanctioned intake of students in the B.Tech programs?
faqs.answer: Ans.The Civil Engineering course, Mechanical Engineering course, Electronics & Communication Engineering course, and the Computer Science and Engineering course each have an intake of 120 students. The Electricals and Electronics Engineering course has an intake of 60 students.

faqs.question: What is the sanctioned intake of students for the M.Tech courses?
faqs.answer: Ans.Each of the M.Tech courses has an intake of 24 students except the CSE course which has an intake of 18 students.

faqs.question: What are the important AP EAMCET dates to keep in mind?
faqs.answer: Ans.The important dates are as follows:EventDateRelease of Application FormFebruary 29, 2020Last date of ApplicationJune 15, 2020Examination DateJuly 27-31, 2020Declaration of ResultsTo be notified soon

faqs.question: What are the contact details of the college?
faqs.answer: Ans.The mailing address of the college is:AITS, Utukur (Post), Chinthakomma Dinne (V&M), Kadapa, YSR (Distt.) Andhra Pradesh - 516 003.You can also contact the college at  (91) 08562 - 201003 or mail them at  aitskadapa@gmail.com.

Section.name: About Annamacharya Institute of Technology and Sciences
Section.description:
Annamacharya Institute of Technology and Science, Kadapa, shortly referred to as AITS, was established in 2010 by the Annamacharya Educational Trust. The college offers 5 B.Tech courses and 6 M.Tech courses from among its 6 departments. Admissions to all courses are strictly based on merit received in the entrance examinations. There are only two entrance exams accepted: the AP EAMCET for undergraduate programmes and the AP PGECET for postgraduate programmes. The college has a long list of recruiters as well as an intense organisational structure for placements. The faculty boasts of the many alumni placed abroad, in public sector companies as well as MNCs.
Table of Content
AITS Kadapa offers a total of 5 B.Tech courses at the undergraduate level for 4 years and 6 M.Tech courses at the postgraduate level for 2 years, from among its 6 departments. The details of the courses are as mentioned below:
Courses
Details
Bachelor of Technology
Duration: 4 years
Eligibility: 10 + 2 with 60% in Mathematics, Physics, and Chemistry as optional subjects
Total Intake: 540 students in all
Specializations: Civil Engineering, Electricals & Electronics Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electronics, and Communication Engineering, Computer Science and Engineering
Selection Criteria: AP EAMCET
Read More
Master of Technology
Duration: 2 years
Eligibility: B.Tech
Total Intake: 114 students in all
Specializations: Computer Science and Engineering, Computer Science, VLSI System Design, Structural Engineering, Electrical Power Systems, and Thermal Engineering
Selection Criteria: AP PGECET
Read More
Read More: AITS Kadapa Fee Structure
Annamacharya Institute of Technology and Sciences AP EAPCET Cutoff 2024 is out. The table given below shows the cutoff for Round 1.
Admission to all the courses are made on the basis of the respective entrance examination. The entrance examination is conducted by the State of Andhra Pradesh. The exam to be given for B.Tech courses in the Andhra Pradesh Engineering, Agricultural Sciences, And Medical Common Entrance Test (EAMCET), while for the M.Tech courses, the scores in the Andhra Pradesh Post-graduate Engineering Common Entrance Test (PGECET) will be considered. Admissions are strictly based on the merit achieved in these examinations. The steps to apply are as mentioned below.
Read More: AITS Kadapa Admission
AITS has a long list of recruiters. The Training and Placement Cell is shared with the other AITS colleges in Rajampet, Tirupati, and Hyderabad. It has a strong organizational structure and conducts many organizations and activities. The Cell conducts diverse pre-placement training sessions, and also provides students with certification programs, projects, internships, and career guidance by experts from industry.

Some of the facilities provided by the college include:
Ques. Can a diploma holder apply for M.Tech?
Ans. Yes, The Convener of the Engineering Common Entrance Test admits 10% of the candidates from the stream of Diploma. However, the applicants should possess a diploma from the Andhra Pradesh State Government or an equivalent examination.
Ques. What is the sanctioned intake of students in the B.Tech programs?
Ans. The Civil Engineering course, Mechanical Engineering course, Electronics & Communication Engineering course, and the Computer Science and Engineering course each have an intake of 120 students. The Electricals and Electronics Engineering course has an intake of 60 students.
Ques. What is the sanctioned intake of students for the M.Tech courses?
Ans. Each of the M.Tech courses has an intake of 24 students except the CSE course which has an intake of 18 students.
Ques. What are the important AP EAMCET dates to keep in mind?

Ques. What are the contact details of the college?
Ans. The mailing address of the college is:
AITS, Utukur (Post), Chinthakomma Dinne (V&M), Kadapa, YSR (Distt.) Andhra Pradesh - 516 003.
You can also contact the college at (91) 08562 - 201003 or mail them at aitskadapa@gmail.com.
